As a pyrogenic virus, influenza affects sperm quality. MacLeod
77 noted that medical students who presented with febrile illness had decreased sperm count, motility, and morphology parameters. Morphology and motility recovered at 4 weeks, as did sperm count at 8 weeks.
78 Buch and Havlovec
78 reported a case of a semen donor who suffered a 24-hour febrile viral illness, who then had decreased sperm count and reduced egg penetration ability 6 and 7 weeks later. Other studies have found similar effects from non-febrile heating such as saunas or laptops.
